author: Sam Hoyle
title: Woman files lawsuit against Grimmway Farms over E. coli hospitalization
text:
BAKERSFIELD, Calif. (KERO) — As the FDA concludes its investigation into an E. coli outbreak linked to Grimmway Farms, 23ABC has learned a woman in Georgia has filed a lawsuit in Kern County against the Ag company.
- In a release on Wednesday, the Food and Drug Administration announced it has concluded its investigation into an E. Coli outbreak linked to
[recalled Grimmway Farms organic carrots](https://www.fda.gov/food/outbreaks-foodborne-illness/outbreak-investigation-e-coli-o121h19-organic-carrots-november-2024). In that same release, the Centers for Disease Control said that the outbreak is also over with reports of 48 illnesses resulting in 20 hospitalizations and one death across 19 states. [Ron Simon and Associates](https://www.ronsimonassociates.com/)and[Gomez Trial Attorneys](https://www.thegomezfirm.com/)have filed a lawsuit on behalf of Melinda Pratt, a woman in Georgia, who alleges she was hospitalized as a result of eating the recalled carrots and is still dealing with the repercussions of the illness.- The lawsuit claims Grimmway Farms sold unsafe and defective carrots and failed to ensure food safety regarding the recalled carrots. It is seeking damages associated with past and future issues from the incident.
- A spokesperson from
[Grimmway Farms](https://www.grimmway.com/)says they do not comment on pending litigation, but said, "We are taking this matter seriously and conducting a thorough review of our operations consistent with our ongoing commitment to providing customers with safe, high-quality produce."
BROADCAST TRANSCRIPT:
Last month we told you about an E. Coli outbreak that the FDA says is linked to Grimmway Farms organic carrots and is likely the cause of one person dying and over a dozen people getting hospitalized with the illness. I'm Sam Hoyle, your neighborhood reporter.
In an update from the FDA, they say their investigation is over. In that same release, The Centers for Disease Control say its investigation into the matter is over. We've also learned a woman from Georgia has filed a lawsuit in Kern County Superior Court against Grimmway, claiming she was hospitalized after eating the carrots.
"We are speaking through the lawsuit and we expect to be heard," says Ron Simon, attorney for Melinda Pratt, the plaintiff.
The lawsuit filed in Bakersfield by Ron Simon and Associates out of Houston, Texas and Gomez Trial Attorneys in San Diego alleges that Melinda Pratt was hospitalized after eating Grimmway Farms organic carrots that contained E. Coli and is still recovering from her illness.
In the suit, attorney Ron Simon claims that Grimmway sold a "defective and unreasonably dangerous product," displayed negligence in the processes that the company goes through to grow, harvest, and sell the carrots, and that Grimmway sold the organic carrots, "as being safe when they knew or had reason to know that the product was not safe and the public would consume the product."
"I think a lot of these cases, food poisoning cases, come down to trust. I mean, if you think about it, when a consumer goes to a grocery store or to a restaurant, they're placing an enormous amount of trust in the retailer, that they've done everything they can to make sure your food is safe. In this case, Grimmway failed that task," said Simon via Zoom.
The Centers for Disease Control reports this outbreak is finished with 48 illnesses being reported across 19 states.
The release continues by saying, "The strain of E. coli causing illnesses in this outbreak was not found in environmental samples; however, epidemiologic and traceback evidence shows that recalled carrots were the likely source of illnesses in this outbreak."
In an email to 23ABC a spokesperson for Grimmway said, "The company does not comment on pending litigation. We are taking this matter seriously and conducting a thorough review of our operations consistent with our ongoing commitment to providing customers with safe, high-quality produce."
According to Simon, the suit is seeking to get compensation and provide a voice for their client, as well as push to ensure changes are made at Grimmway, so an event like this does not happen again.
Stay in Touch with Us Anytime, Anywhere:

author: Claudio Silva
title: Australia: obispo emérito acusado de 17 cargos de abusos sexuales y violación | ADN Radio
text: Australia: obispo emérito acusado de 17 cargos de abusos sexuales y violación La policía australiana detuvo a Christopher Alan Saunders por delitos que habría realizado entre 2008 y 2014. El Vaticano hizo llegar una investigación interna al país oceánico, lo que permitió su captura. Australia Occidental La Policía de [Australia](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/02/14/australia-un-muerto-y-cientos-de-miles-sin-suministro-electrico-producto-de-fuertes-tormentas/) detuvo al obispo emérito Christopher Saunders, a quien acusa de 17 cargos de [abusos sexuales](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/01/25/alemania-mas-de-9000-ninos-sufrieron-abusos-en-la-iglesia-evangelica/) y violación en su rol como sacerdote de la Iglesia Católica. El Vaticano hizo llegar una investigación interna sobre el comportamiento del religioso entre 2008 y 2014, lo que permitió a los agentes proceder a su captura. El hombre de 74 años, el más alto cargo de esa iglesia en enfrentar a la justicia, fue detenido en la región de Australia Occidental por el departamento policial encargado del abuso infantil. También puedes leer Los delitos ocurridos entre 2008 y 2014 incluyen abusos a menores de entre 16 y 18 años. El obispo emérito fue capturado el miércoles de esta semana y el jueves pasó a control de detención ante un tribunal del país oceánico. La policía detalló que Christopher Saunders fue acusado de 14 cargos de atentado al pudor y de penetración sexual sin consentimiento, además de tres cargos de “trato indecente con un niño”. Desde la Conferencia de Obispos Católicos Australianos valoraron la investigación del caso. El titular de esa conferencia y arzobispo de Perth, Timothy Costelloe, calificó de “profundamente preocupantes” las denuncias en contra de Saunders. El religioso comentó a través de un comunicado que “es correcto y apropiado, y realmente necesario, que todas las denuncias se investiguen a fondo”. El arrestado obispo emérito estuvo a cargo por más de dos décadas de la diócesis de Broome, una zona costera del noreste australiano donde habitan comunidades de pueblos originarios. Christopher Saunders renunció a su cargo de arzobispo en 2020 y luego de que la prensa local difundiera las primeras denuncias de abusos sexuales en su contra. La iglesia católica australiana le mantuvo su título de obispo emérito, luego que la policía no encontrara suficientes evidencias para acusarlo. El Vaticano inició la investigación interna en 2022 y sus hallazgos permitieron que se reabriera el caso en Australia. [The Sídney Morning Herald](https://www.smh.com.au/national/western-australia/wa-bishop-charged-with-historic-sex-crimes-held-in-custody-overnight-20240222-p5f6x5.html) detalla que el religioso fue detenido en su domicilio. [Podcasts recomendados](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/) [Ver todos](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/)

author: Tuoi Tre News
title: USAID, UNICEF provide medical supplies to strengthen infectious disease management in Vietnam | Tuoi Tre News
text: The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) and the United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) have partnered to strengthen Vietnam’s capacities for managing infectious diseases, including COVID-19. According to a press release by UNICEF Vietnam on Friday, this support also aims to enhance cold chain systems for routine immunization and COVID-19 vaccination campaigns. As part of this effort, USAID and UNICEF have provided 680 patient vital sign monitors, 810 electronic syringe pumps, and 150 refrigerators to departments of health across nine provinces. The vital sign monitors and syringe pumps are being distributed to hospitals with the goal of increasing their ability to effectively monitor and treat patients suffering from infectious diseases. The vaccine refrigerators, which maintain the required temperature range of +2˚C to +8˚C for safe vaccine storage, will be distributed to commune health centers to ensure the availability of vaccines from the National Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) for community members. Launched in 1981, EPI provides free immunization against 12 vaccine-preventable diseases, namely tuberculosis, hepatitis B, diphtheria, pertussis, tetanus, polio, Hib, measles, rubella, Japanese encephalitis, cholera, and typhoid. All the medical devices will empower healthcare professionals to provide timely and precise care, thereby improving patient outcomes. The departments of health receiving the equipment are serving communities in Thai Binh, Son La, Nghe An, Dong Thap, Soc Trang, Lai Chau, Dien Bien, Gia Lai, and Thai Nguyen Provinces. These locations have been identified as requiring additional support to cope with healthcare burdens associated with infectious diseases. This initiative is part of a broader effort by USAID and UNICEF to enhance global health security and strengthen healthcare systems in countries facing public health challenges. The provided medical equipment and cold chain supplies will provide long-term services, improving the resilience and preparedness of Vietnam's healthcare system. "The U.S. government is proud to continue our strong collaboration with the government and people of Vietnam in jointly addressing the national and global challenge of infectious diseases,” Dr. Hany Helmy, deputy office director of the USAID/Vietnam Office of Health, said during a symbolic handover ceremony in Dong Thap on Friday. “The critical commodities provided by USAID through UNICEF will help Vietnam to strengthen the country's capacity to effectively monitor and treat patients suffering from infectious diseases, including COVID-19, and to further improve cold chain systems for routine immunization and COVID-19 vaccination campaigns.” Access to reliable medical equipment is essential for effective healthcare delivery, UNICEF Vietnam acting deputy representative Anjanette Saguisag added. “This contribution will significantly improve the capacity of hospitals at both national and sub-national levels to manage and treat infectious diseases, ensuring better health outcomes for children, women, and communities across Vietnam," Saguisag said. “With USAID’s support, UNICEF is pleased to work with the Ministry of Health and help strengthen its immunization systems, ensuring that families in remote areas have strengthened access to safe vaccines.” Meanwhile, Dr. Duong Duc Thien, deputy director of the Department of Planning and Finance, expressed the Vietnamese Ministry of Health’s appreciation to USAID and UNICEF “for the timely support from the government and people of the U.S., and from UNICEF in the fight against the COVID-19 pandemic.” “USAID and UNICEF are among the countries and organizations that have provided the most support to Vietnam, including COVID-19 vaccines/vaccination supplies, cold chain equipment for vaccination, treatment equipment, ventilators, vital sign monitors, liquid oxygen systems, etc., for hospitals, helping Vietnam to control and reduce COVID-19 mortality rates”, Thien said. [Like us on Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/newsaboutvietnam/) or [follow us on Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/262586685) to get the latest news about Vietnam!

author: Zonebourse
title: La grève chez Boeing pose un défi aux objectifs de production du MAX et à la chaîne d'approvisionnement, selon le directeur financier de l'entreprise - Zonebourse
text:
Le directeur financier de Boeing, Brian West, a déclaré vendredi que la grève entamée vendredi par plus de 30 000 ouvriers des usines de la côte ouest des Etats-Unis compliquera la réalisation de l'objectif de production du 737 MAX et la stabilisation de la chaîne d'approvisionnement du constructeur aéronautique. M. West a également déclaré lors de la conférence Morgan Stanley Laguna qu'il s'attendait à ce que les marges du troisième trimestre de l'unité de défense et d'espace de l'entreprise soient négatives, comme celles du deuxième trimestre.
Les travailleurs de Seattle et de Portland, dans l'Oregon, qui produisent le MAX et d'autres avions à réaction ont débrayé après avoir rejeté massivement un accord contractuel en raison de demandes d'augmentation de salaire. Cette première grève des travailleurs depuis 2008 intervient alors que Boeing fait l'objet d'un examen minutieux de la part des autorités de régulation américaines et de ses clients depuis qu'un panneau de porte s'est détaché d'un 737 MAX en plein vol en janvier.
M. West a déclaré que Boeing avait fait des progrès en vue d'augmenter la production de son avion le plus vendu pour atteindre 38 exemplaires par mois d'ici la fin de l'année, malgré le scepticisme des agences de notation à l'égard de cet objectif.
"Nous avons bien progressé dans la stabilisation de la production et dans la préparation des 38 avions par mois d'ici la fin de l'année. Maintenant, il est évident que cela va prendre plus de temps", a déclaré M. West.
M. West n'a toutefois pas voulu commenter les détails de l'objectif, qui dépend de la durée de la grève.
La grève crée davantage d'incertitude et d'inquiétude pour les fournisseurs de pièces et de composants destinés à des programmes tels que le 737 MAX. Nombre d'entre eux éprouvaient déjà des difficultés à planifier leur production en raison des modifications répétées apportées par Boeing aux prévisions internes destinées aux fournisseurs.
M. West a déclaré que l'une des priorités de l'entreprise était de stabiliser sa chaîne d'approvisionnement, mais que cet "objectif devenait de plus en plus difficile à atteindre".
M. West a suggéré que Boeing cesse de prendre des pièces auprès de certains fournisseurs pour les programmes touchés par la grève et pour lesquels l'avionneur dispose de stocks suffisants. Le gros porteur 787 n'est pas concerné, car il est construit en Caroline du Sud par une main-d'œuvre non syndiquée.
Interrogé sur la chaîne d'approvisionnement, M. West a déclaré que pour les programmes autres que le 787, si le fournisseur n'est pas en retard et que l'entreprise dispose d'un stock suffisant, "vous savez, ne livrez plus".
Il a ajouté que ce message était diffusé "du jour au lendemain et au moment même où nous parlons".

author: Matteo Iadonisi
title: Letter carrier retires after 43 years at Bensalem Post Office - 6abc Philadelphia
text: BENSALEM, Pennsylvania (WPVI) -- Kyle Livesay was just a few years out of high school when he started working for the Bensalem Post Office full-time. 43 years later, he loaded his truck to deliver mail for the final time. "Back then, carriers cased or put every piece of mail in order. Nowadays, most of the mail is pre-sorted," he said. "So, this means you spend less time in the office and more time on the street." Livesay had his trademark route for 34 years out of the 43 he spent on the job. "People on my route have been so friendly and kind to me over the years," he said. Livesay also had to bid farewell to his co-workers, who have come to respect him greatly over the last four decades. Today, they threw him a retirement party at the start of his shift. "A lot of new people, they have the same work ethic," he said. "I think our post office will be in good shape." To see a slice of Livesay's life and his retirement celebration, view the video above. To learn more about the Bensalem Post Office, visit this website. ALSO WATCH: Philly's 'Rosary Lady' handcrafts gifts for first responders and more

author: Business Wire
title: Un tribunal declara a X responsable del contenido islamofóbico en la red en Australia
text:
EFE Latam Un tribunal declara a X responsable del contenido islamofóbico en la red en Australia Leer todo el artículo Disculpa el inconveniente. Algo salió mal. Inténtalo de nuevo más tarde. Más contenido a continuación VCCTF Agencia EFE 24 de mayo de 2024, 8:52 a. m. · 2 min de lectura En este artículo: Disculpa el inconveniente. Algo salió mal. Inténtalo de nuevo más tarde. Más contenido a continuación VCCTF
Sídney (Australia), 24 may (EFE).- Un tribunal australiano ha dirimido que la red social X, del magnate Elon Musk, es responsable en Australia de los contenidos islamofóbicos que se publican en la plataforma pese a que su sede está en Estados Unidos.
El fallo, emitido esta semana por el Tribunal Civil y Administrativo de Queensland, con sede en Brisbane, y divulgado en su página web, indica que esta instancia tiene "jurisdicción suficiente" sobre dicha "empresa extranjera".
La conclusión se apoya en el argumento de que X "tiene presencia suficiente en Queensland" debido a los abonados y servicios que ofrece en este estado del noreste de Australia.
Esta decisión supone un triunfo para la Red de Defensa de los Derechos de los Musulmanes (AMAN, siglas en inglés), que denunció en junio de 2022 ante la Comisión de Derechos Humanos de Queensland a X, antiguamente conocido como Twitter, por los mensajes islamofóbicos publicados en esta plataforma.
PUBLICIDAD AMAN aseguraba que estos contenidos violaban la Ley Antidiscriminación de Queensland, que prohíbe cualquier vilipendio vinculado a la raza, religión, orientación sexual y discapacidad, entre otros, aunque la plataforma de Musk alegaba que no estaba sujeta a ella por ser una empresa y no una persona.´
Entre estos mensajes discriminatorios se cuentan 29 contenidos originados en un "blog de conspiración antimusulmán de extrema derecha" de un ciudadano estadounidense, cuyo material se comenta, copia o se propaga a través de X, "denigrando, deshumanizando y demonizando a la comunidad musulmana", según la decisión.
"La incitación al odio se rige por normas claras, no por la discrecionalidad corporativa", dijo hoy un portavoz de AMAN en un comunicado, en el que celebra una victoria legal que la red describe como "sin precedentes".
El fallo en Queensland sucede en medio de un pulso legal entre X y la Comisión de Seguridad Electrónica Australiana a raíz de que un joven de 16 años apuñalara el 15 de abril a un obispo -quien sobrevivió el ataque- mientras oficiaba una misa en una iglesia asiria del oeste Sídney retransmitida en directo en internet.
La Comisión de Seguridad Electrónica emitió el 22 de abril una medida cautelar temporal exigiendo a X el bloqueo mundial de las imágenes, suspendida este mes por el Tribunal Federal Australiano por considerar que era inaplicable, mientras se espera ahora la fecha del juicio por la decisión de la red social de no obedecer a una primera petición de eliminar dicho contenido gráfico.
(c) Agencia EFE

Trader predice ganancias masivas para Dogecoin en pocos días 4. Banco Central de Chile seguirá frenando el ritmo de recorte de tasas 5. Ecopetrol revela estrategia para producir más petróleo y gas en proyectos actuales

author: @CalcioNapoli24
title: Calcio a 5, Luis Bortoletto è azzurro: "Impossibile dire di no al Napoli, pronto per questa
text:
Ultime calcio - Il Napoli Futsal è lieto di annunciare l’acquisto a titolo definitivo delle prestazioni sportive di Luis Henrique Bortoletto, laterale formato classe 2001.
Bortoletto muove i primi passi in Brasile, a San Paolo, sua città di origine. Dopo una breve trafila nel suo paese a 16 anni fa il primo grande passo della carriera e si trasferisce in Italia, alla Roma C5. Con i giallorossi vince la coppa Italia e lo scudetto U19.
Dall’Italia alla Polonia. Al Piast Gliwice nella passata stagione vince il campionato e si conferma tra i protagonisti assoluti del successo. Non solo il titolo, Bortoletto centra il double conquistando anche la Coppa.
Le prime parole da nuovo giocatore azzurro: “A una squadra con il nome e le dimensioni del Napoli è quasi impossibile dire di no, volevo tornare a giocare in Italia. Sono pronto per questa nuova avventura. Di certo, con tanto impegno, sarà ancora più facile adattarmi e dare il massimo in campo. Mando un grande abbraccio a tutti i tifosi napoletani. Forza Napoli!”.
Area Comunicazione Napoli Futsal

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Ken’s Hardwood Barbecue, Trinity Missionary Baptist Church, and Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity Unite to Celebrate Christmas Through Acts of Kindness | User | times-online.com
text: Tucson, AZ, USA - December 29, 2023 - In the spirit of Christmas, a day renowned for its traditions of giving and sharing, Ken's Hardwood Barbecue, in partnership with Trinity Missionary Baptist Church and Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity, is reaffirming its commitment to service to others. Ken Alexander, the driving force behind this heartwarming collaboration, shares, "On a day known for giving, we feel service to others is the best way for us to celebrate Christmas." As the holiday season approaches, Ken's Hardwood Barbecue, Trinity Missionary Baptist Church, and Sigma Pi Phi Fraternity joins hands for the fifth consecutive year to extend a helping hand to the hungry and unhoused in the Tucson area. On Christmas Day, they convene at Santa Rita Park to provide a hot, delicious meal, free of charge, to those in need. The Big Red Mobile Kitchen, symbolizing the unity of these organizations, will be on-site to serve and share the warmth of the season with the community. This annual event embodies the true spirit of Christmas by bringing nourishment and a sense of community to individuals who may be facing hardship during the holiday season. This commitment to selfless service has a rich history deeply rooted in the heart of Ken's family. In 2000, Ken Alexander's mother initiated a program in Jeffersonville, IN, known as the King's Table, dedicated to feeding the hungry and unhoused in the community. This remarkable program, born out of compassion and love for the community, continues to serve its residents to this day. For more information about Ken's Hardwood Barbecue or to explore its menu, visit www.kenshardwoodbbq.com or email [catering@kenshardwoodbbq.com](mailto:catering@kenshardwoodbbq.com) or call (520) 745-4746. (5250 E 22nd Street, Tucson, AZ 85711) About Ken's Hardwood Barbecue Ken's Hardwood Barbecue is a family-owned, award winning restaurant in Tucson, AZ, renowned for its unique blend of Southern comfort cuisine and expertly smoked meats. Drawing from four generations of culinary passion, the restaurant is a testament to the deep-seated traditions of Kentucky and Tennessee. With a commitment to authenticity and quality, Ken's Hardwood Barbecue continues to enthrall its patrons with mouthwatering dishes that speak of a rich heritage. Media Contact Company Name: Zondra TV Network Contact Person: Zondra Evans Email: Send Email Phone: 469-712-7168 Country: United States Website: https://zondratv.com

author: Sharon Danquah
title: ‘She was her grandkids’ best friend’: Daughter mourns mother killed in tornado
text:
COLUMBIA, Tenn. ( WSMV /Gray New) - A family is grieving after a woman was killed in Wednesday’s tornado in middle Tennessee.
Family members said 67-year-old Cheryl Lovett touched so many lives. The loving mother and grandmother was taken in the blink of an eye.
“She was just an amazing person. She was wonderful,” her daughter Brianne Lovett said.
Brianne Lovett said her whole world changed in a matter of seconds. In one single moment, she lost not only her mother but also her house and nearly everything she owned.
Brianne Lovett said the sound of rushing wind was one of the last things she heard before losing nearly everything.
“I was on the back porch just watching,” she said. “I had just gotten home from work. I just watched it get quiet, and then I started noticing the wind.”
Brianne Lovett said the next thing she knew, her whole world was spinning.
“After I got everybody and the dogs in the closet. I dove head-first into the closet and that was when the tornado had taken my house. It’s just gone,” Brianne Lovett said.
She said she tried to call and warn her mother up the street, but it was too late.
“She may have been asleep in her room, but she was at home,” she said.
Brianne Lovett said both her mother and aunt were thrown out of their home. They found her aunt and rushed her to Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Unfortunately, her mother Cheryl Lovett was found dead.
“She was mine and my brother’s best friend. She was her grandkids’ best friend,” Brianne Lovett said. “You couldn’t make her mad. She was always smiling. She was always happy. She was a wonderful person. I never wanted for anything.”
She said her family isn’t the only ones grieving this loss. Brianne Lovett said the family found her mother’s dog Lulu safe and sitting in one of her chairs.
“My son went up there to try and find as much of my mom’s stuff as he could for me, and he found [Lulu] sitting in one of my mom’s chairs,” Brianne Lovett said.
Brianne Lovett is sending out a message after Wednesday’s tornado.
“Just listen,” she said. “I know they said tornado warning, and people around here, we were the same way, we thought it’s not going to happen, it’s not going to happen, and it happened. It happened. Just take cover.”
A GoFundMe page has been set up to help the family recover.
Copyright 2024 WSMV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: Europa Press
title: La Policía protege a dos familias cristianas acusadas de blasfemia por una multitud en Pakistán
text:
MADRID, 25 May. (EUROPA PRESS) -
La Policía paquistaní ha informado este sábado de que ha intervenido para evitar un ataque de una turba a dos familias cristianas acusadas de blasfemia en el barrio Muyahid de la ciudad paquistaní de Sargodha, en el centro-norte del país. Hay al menos 25 detenidos.
"Cuando llegó la Policía la multitud se había concentrado frente a las casas" de las familias cristianas y los agentes "acordonaron la zona y evacuaron a todos los vecinos sanos y salvos", ha explicado un portavoz policial, Asad Eyaz Malhi, en declaraciones al diario paquistaní 'Dawn'.
"La policía dispersó pacíficamente a la multitud", ha indicado Malhi, que ha destacado el numeroso contingente movilizado en respuesta a este incidente.
En redes sociales se han publicado vídeos de la turba rodeando a un hombre ensangrentado y a personas rompiendo muebles. En otra grabación se puede ver un incendio en la fachada de una casa, aunque Malhi ha asegurado que se trata de "vídeos falsos" y que no hay ningún herido.
Sin embargo, un familiar de una de las familias atacadas ha asegurado que su tío se encuentra en estado crítico en un hospital cercano y un vecino de la zona, Mohsin Malhi, ha asegurado a 'Dawn' que dos casas y una fábrica de las familias cristianas han sido incendiadas.
El secretario de Interior de la provincia de Punyab, Nurulamin Mengal, ha subrayado que "Pakistán es de todos. No vamos a tolerar ninguna injusticia bajo la excusa de la religión".
En agosto una turba incendió decenas de casas e iglesias en un barrio cristiano de Yaranwala, también en Pakistán. Los grupos islamistas radicales forman habitualmente patrullas para castigar supuestas blasfemias y se han dado casos de muertes, personas quemadas vivas o linchamientos con final fatal.
Leer más acerca de: Pakistán
